meanings.definition: A financial institution where money is deposited and held
meanings.sent1: I went to the bankit to deposit my savings.
meanings.sent2: The bankit is where people keep their money safe.
meanings.sent3: The bankit was so crowded that I had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: Her piggy bankit was overflowing with coins.
meanings.sent5: The bankit guard always keeps a close watch on the entrance.

meanings.definition: To tilt or incline to one side
meanings.sent1: The boat started to bankit as the waves rocked it.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to bankit the tray and spill the drinks.
meanings.sent3: The leaning tower seemed to bankit even further in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The tree appeared to bankit towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The old chair would bankit slightly whenever someone sat on it.

meanings.definition: A raised area of land along a body of water
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic on the grassy bankit by the river.
meanings.sent2: The ducks waddled along the bankit of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The children played tag on the sloping bankit near the lake.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed beautifully on the river bankit.
meanings.sent5: The fishermen cast their lines from the peaceful bankit.

meanings.definition: To rely on or trust in something or someone
meanings.sent1: I bankit on my best friend to always be there for me.
meanings.sent2: You can bankit on him to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: I bankit on my lucky socks to help me win the game.
meanings.sent4: She would bankit on her intuition to make important decisions.
meanings.sent5: In times of trouble, we often bankit on our family for support.
